column1: Para-aminobenzoic acid (PABA) is a naturally occurring substance that is often used in sunscreen products.
PABA is used in certain sunscreen and skin care products.

- Coma - Diarrhea - Dizziness - Eye irritation if it touches the eyes - Fever - Liver failure - Nausea - Rash (allergic) - Shortness of breath - Slowed breathing - Stupor (altered thinking and decreased level of consciousness) - Vomiting Note: Most PABA reactions are due to allergic reactions, not overdoses.
Do NOT give water or milk if the patient is having symptoms (such as vomiting, convulsions, or a decreased level of alertness) that make it hard to swallow.
